title: Reflexion [NeurIPS 2023]

definitions.Reflexion: Reflexion uses verbal reinforcement to help agents learn from prior failings, i.e., converting binary (e.g., success/fail) or scalar feedback from the environment into verbal feedback in the form of a textual summary, which is then added as additional context for the MLLM agent in the next episode.

summary: The slide discusses 'Reflexion', a method that uses verbal reinforcement to help agents learn from their failures by converting feedback into textual summaries. It outlines three models: Actor, Evaluator, and Self-Reflection model, each with a specific role in the learning process.
